docs.title: Minimum Requirements
docs.text:
• PHP 7.4 required or greater
  • MySQL 5.6 or greater is recommended
  • WooCommerce 9.0.0 or greater
  • WordPress 6.1 or greater

docs.title: Automatic Installation
docs.text:
1. Go to WordPress Plugins > Add New Search for "Pay with ConnectIPS"
  2. Click Install and then activate Plugin

docs.title: Manual Installation
docs.text:
If for some reason automatic installation is not possible, go to https://wordpress.org/plugins/pay-with-connectips/ and you will see the download button. Clicking download button will provide you with a zip file of the plugin then.

  1. Go to WordPress Plugins > Add New and click upload plugin.
  2. Click upload plugin and then add the zip file
  3. The plugin will then be installed, then activate the plugin.

docs.title: General Setup
docs.text:
Once activated, go to WooCommerce > Settings > Payments and enable the ConnectIPS payment gateway.

Once enabled, you will be able to see the ConnectIPS payment gateway in the list of payment methods.

docs.title: Configure ConnectIPS
docs.text: To configure the ConnectIPS payment gateway, go to WooCommerce > Settings > Payments > ConnectIPS and fill in the required fields.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: You need configure the ConnectIPS payment gateway in WooCommerce > Settings > Payments > ConnectIPS as shown in image below:

docs.title: Enable/Disable
docs.text: Enable or disable the ConnectIPS payment gateway.

docs.title: Title
docs.text: The title of the ConnectIPS payment gateway.

docs.title: Merchant ID
docs.text: Merchant ID is and unique identifier to identify merchant in the system. Merchant ID will be provided by NCHL upon registering merchant for connectIPS Core Module on banks’ request

docs.title: Application ID
docs.text: Unique identification, which will be used to identify the accountdetails of the merchant’s application. A merchant can have multiple applications based on different banks account used for various shopping sites. Application Id will be provided by NCHL after registration.

docs.title: Application Name
docs.text: Application name to identify merchant as well as originating application.

docs.title: Passphrase
docs.text: Passphrase to decrypt the digital certificate private key (pfx file/keystore).

docs.title: Basic Authentication Password
docs.text: Basic authentication password provided in email for transaction validation.

docs.title: User Redirection URLs
docs.text: Before performing transactions, a static pair of successURL and failureURL has to be provided to the connectIPS integration support team. connectIPS itself handles user redirection and sends the user to whichever URL provided for testing after entering the OTP. Please provide full URL to the connectIPS integration support team.

docs.title: Enable Test Payment
docs.text: Enable test payments from connectIPS on test URL instead of live URL.
